info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued August 31 at 12:58PM PDT until August 31 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM PDT FRIDAY... * CHANGES...Issued another Lake Wind Advisory for Friday, only for Lahontan Reservoir. * WHAT...For the Lake Wind Advisory today, southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. Waves 2 to 4 feet. For the Lake Wind Advisory on Friday, southwest winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. Waves 1 to 3 feet. * WHERE...For the first Lake Wind Advisory, Pyramid Lake, Lahontan and Rye Path Reservoirs. For the second Lake Wind Advisory, Lahontan Reservoir. * WHEN...For the first Lake Wind Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the second Lake Wind Advisory, from 10 AM to 8 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to capsizing and should remain off lake waters until conditions improve. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will remain breezy on Friday across Pyramid Lake and Rye Patch Reservoir. However, they should remain below advisory criteria.
info.instruction: Check lake conditions before heading out and be prepared for a sudden increase in winds and wave heights. Consider postponing boating activities on the lake until a day with less wind.
